about.summary: Encryption wrappers, using low-level support from 'sodium' and 'openssl'.  'cyphr' tries to smooth over some pain points when using encryption within applications and data analysis by wrapping around differences in function names and arguments in different encryption providing packages.  It also provides high-level wrappers for input/output functions for seamlessly adding encryption to existing analyses.

Encryption wrappers, using low-level support from 'sodium' and 'openssl'.  'cyphr' tries to smooth over some pain points when using encryption within applications and data analysis by wrapping around differences in function names and arguments in different encryption providing packages.  It also provides high-level wrappers for input/output functions for seamlessly adding encryption to existing analyses.

name: r-cyphr
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "1.1.7" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-cyphr
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/cyphr_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/cyphr/cyphr_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: eacd75b6932217c2b8fdf43acac9a7669ea640cb174aa505d5e582f0e20c6a7f

build:
  number: 0
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip  # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-getpass
    - r-openssl >=0.9.9
    - r-sodium >=1.2.1
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-getpass
    - r-openssl >=0.9.9
    - r-sodium >=1.2.1

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('cyphr')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('cyphr')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://github.com/ropensci/cyphr
  license: MIT
  license_file: LICENSE
  summary: Encryption wrappers, using low-level support from 'sodium' and 'openssl'.  'cyphr' tries to smooth over some pain points when using encryption within applications and data analysis by wrapping around differences in function names and arguments in different encryption providing packages.  It also provides high-level
    wrappers for input/output functions for seamlessly adding encryption to existing analyses.
  license_family: MIT

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - ocefpaf
